info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 3:21PM EDT until August 06 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Flood Advisory for portions of Surry, Carroll, and Patrick counties until 630 PM EDT... ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central North Carolina, including the following county, Surry. Portions of southwest Virginia, including the following counties, Carroll and Patrick. * WHEN...Until 630 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 318 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated a large area of heavy rainfall rain due to showers and thunderstorms continuing to move through the region. Overflowing poor drainage areas will result in minor flooding within the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have already fallen during the past hour or so. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Big Creek, Beaver Creek, Ararat River, Archies Creek and Beaverdam Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible during the next few hours. Additional rainfall will aggrevate the potential for flooding. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Mount Airy... Fairview... Flat Rock... Dobson... Cana... Ararat... Bottom... - For additional information please go to our web site located at: http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
